section.title: PoD at GSI
section.para: For GSI users there is a pre-compiled and tuned version of PoD. From the Download page get the tar ball of the PoD, which is marked by "for GSI environment only". For installation and configuration details please refer to user’s manual.

section.title: PoD at CERN’s AFS
section.para:
PoD has been tested and is used at CERN. The following environment settings could help to build PoD from the source in a CERN AFS directory on lxplus.cern.ch.
export ROOTSYS=/afs/cern.ch/sw/lcg/app/releases/ROOT/5.26.00a/slc4_amd64_gcc34/root/ export PATH=/afs/cern.ch/sw/lcg/external/CMake/2.6.4/slc4_amd64_gcc34/bin:\ /afs/cern.ch/sw/lcg/external/qt/4.4.2/slc4_amd64_gcc34/bin:$ROOTSYS/bin:$PATH export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/afs/cern.ch/sw/lcg/external/qt/4.4.2/slc4_amd64_gcc34/lib:\ /afs/cern.ch/sw/lcg/external/Boost/1.35.0_python2.5/slc4_amd64_gcc34/lib:\ $ROOTSYS/lib:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH export BOOST_LOCATION=/afs/cern.ch/sw/lcg/external/Boost/1.35.0_python2.5/slc4_amd64_gcc34/ export BOOST_ROOT=/afs/cern.ch/sw/lcg/external/Boost/1.35.0_python2.5/slc4_amd64_gcc34/

Since AFS doesn’t support pipes you need to change PoD’s working directory in the user defaults configuration file $POD_LOCATION/etc/PoD.cfg to /tmp/[login name]/ or to something like that:
[server] # # PoD working directory # work_dir=/tmp/manafov/
